main event: Dr. and Mrs. Russell Bright of Sturgis, Michigan reported seeing a celestial object that was determined to be the planet Venus, but they noted that astronomical bodies can appear distorted due to atmospheric conditions.
interesting points: The object was circular in shape, approximately 100 feet in diameter, and emitted a dim green and darkling light.
The object hovered, slowly descended, and made a rapid tilting movement to the west before descending further and shooting off to the northeast at high speed.
The object was observed multiple times over the course of a month, typically between 11:30 PM and 1:00 AM.
The observer, a general manager of a chemical company, stated that the object was unlike anything he had ever seen and he was unable to determine what it was.
The observer was unable to take photographs of the object.
sighted object: a circular object with a dim green and darkling light
witnesses: Dr. and Mrs. Russell Bright, a general manager of a chemical company
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
